paragraphs.text: United States polarising - inequality and injustice escalating.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Protests in the wake of the police killing of Michael Brown in Ferguson, MO, and uprisings throughout the US and the world following the grand jury's refusal to indict police officer Daren Wilson express a new wave of resistance and struggle against centuries old injustices of poverty, racial oppression, and state violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The context of today's struggles is the history of United States' genocide of indigenous peoples and enslavement of African peoples, coupled with exploitation and oppression of immigrant workers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: to maximise profits for the slavocracy ruling the country till the Civil War and the emerging industrial corporate class
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Heroic movements in each century fought to lessen economic inequality, white supremacy, and gender oppression
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Reforms were won and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: new laws passed
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But counter-revolution and reaction asserted itself: From slavery to Jim Crow, from lynch rope to drug wars, mass incarceration, wanton police murder of black lives, and state violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Major victories of the past left intact the economic and political system of global capitalism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Historic inequalities and oppressions rooted in realities of race, nationality, and gender evolved within the class relations of capitalism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Race and class are deeply intertwined in shaping the economic, political, and social relations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As the economic system develops, these disparities and injustices are exacerbated, and are driven by the deep structural changes in the nature of work, the relations between labour and corporations (capital), and the state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the current moment economic and political polarisation is intensifying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is highly racialised
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: impacting blacks disproportionately
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: given the history of white supremacy it could not be otherwise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The technological revolution at the foundation of the economy - the development of computers, digitisation, automation, and robots - dates from the 1950s
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It took off in the 1980s and is in high gear in the twenty-first century
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is radically transforming every aspect of the economy, including production, distribution, communication, knowledge and culture, and impacts our daily lives in ways never imagined
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The economy shifted from a machine- based system that enhanced workers' productivity to an electronic-based system that is labour-replacing and increasingly displaces workers, but is ever more productive and cheaper with robotic labour
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Everything changes - globalisation, wealth, work, wages, war, and the state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Numbers tell the story of these stark realities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a world where the 85 richest people owned $110 trillion in wealth, equal to that of the poorest 3.5 billion people combined in 2013
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: the United States is the most unequal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Here, in the aftermath of the Great Recession, the top 1 percent earned 95 percent of total income gains since 2009, compared to the bottom 99 percent who earned a meager 5 percent of gains
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Race matters, of course
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Black median household income was $35,416 in 2014, less than 60 percent of white income at $59,754
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Unemployment in 2014 inched below 6 percent, but was still 9.6 million workers
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: This doubled if the 2.1 million discouraged workers and the 7.3 million part-time workers wanting full-time work were added
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Again
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: black unemployment at 11.4 percent was double that of whites at 5.3
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The new electronic economy renders huge swaths of US and global workers disposable, and thus "dangerous" to the system that has discarded them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Over the last fifty years there have been profound changes in state policies and practices to manage and contain this new reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From safety net to neoliberalism and austerity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From welfare state to warfare state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From civil rights to incarceration and deportation nation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The militarisation of the police, state violence, and corporate control of the state are escalating
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Again race matters
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A white police officer has killed a black person about two times a week from 2006 to 2012
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Since 1997, the Department of Defense has given $5.1bn in equipment to state and local police departments
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Homeland Security has made grants worth $41bn since 2002
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: And the Pentagon, beginning in 2006, has given local police departments $1.9bn of equipment - including 600 mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicles (MRAPs), 80,000 assault rifles, 200 grenade launchers, and 12,000 bayonets
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The state directs and protects the US and global economy in the interests of a tiny class of corporate billionaires
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who have bought control of local and national governments and international financial institutions, and wage war at home and abroad to maintain their wealth and power
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No one believes Ferguson is an isolated incident
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to make the leap in our understanding that it represents systemic state violence that demands fundamental reorganisation of power and the economy requires political education connected to political struggle
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Our vision and our strategy for the emerging movement have to move along the path to a new society that is cooperative and egalitarian, and organised to satisfy human needs and protect the earth
paragraphs.label: assumption
